name: CheckboxGroup
description: Provides a shared state to a series of checkboxes.

defaultValue.description:
Names of the checkboxes in the group that should be initially ticked.

To render a controlled checkbox group, use the `value` prop instead.

value.description:
Names of the checkboxes in the group that should be ticked.

To render an uncontrolled checkbox group, use the `defaultValue` prop instead.

onValueChange.description:
Event handler called when a checkbox in the group is ticked or unticked.
Provides the new value as an argument.
onValueChange.detailedType:
| ((
    value: string[],
    eventDetails: CheckboxGroupChangeEventDetails,
  ) => void)
| undefined

allValues.description: Names of all checkboxes in the group. Use this when creating a parent checkbox.

disabled.description: Whether the component should ignore user interaction.

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.

style.detailedType:
| React.CSSProperties
| ((
    state: CheckboxGroup.State,
  ) => CSSProperties | undefined)
| undefined

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.detailedType:
| ReactElement
| ((
    props: HTMLProps,
    state: CheckboxGroup.State,
  ) => ReactElement)

data-disabled.description: Present when the checkbox group is disabled.
